thread.title: Ioane brothers named in Blues XV to face Rebels
thread.title_full: Ioane brothers named in Blues XV to face Rebels

title: Ioane brothers named in Blues XV to face Rebels
text:
'He had such a presence' 0:59 Super Rugby week 1 teams: Rieko and Akira Ioane named in Blues team to face Rebels  19am Source: FOX SPORTS WE’RE set for lift-off. 
The Auckland Blues have named their squad for this Thursday’s Super Rugby opening clash against the Melbourne Rebels at AAMI Park. 
Dual international Sonny Bill Williams won’t be available until midway through the season. 
Also missing are last year’s captains James Parsons and Jerome Kaino, while lock Patrick Tuipulotu will also miss the match after recently being cleared to rejoin the squad after a drug scare. 
Blues coach Tana Umaga has named a tight five, boasting just 19 Blues caps between them. However, they impressed in their pre-season win against the Chiefs last week. 
While they may have just a handful of Blues appearances, two of them are proven performers with prop Pauliasi Manu and new captain Jimmy Tupou boasting 91 Super Rugby appearances between them. 
Manu, who returns to the Blues after four years at the Chiefs, anchors a scrum with North Harbour prop Sione Mafileo and Northland captain Matt Moulds, who gets a start after an apprenticeship behind All Blacks Keven Mealamu and James Parsons. 
Steve Luatua, Blake Gibson and Akira Ioane form an explosive backrow combination. Rieko Ioane and Akira Ioane will start for the Blues against the Rebels on Thursday. Source: Getty Images 
One of last year’s breakout stars Melani Nanai shifts from fullback to the wing to accommodate Michael Collins. 
Rieko Ioane, meanwhile, shifts to his preferred position at outside centre and he joins Piers Francis in the midfield. 
As expected, Augustine Pulu partners Ihaia West in the halves combination. 
Umaga has named a strong bench with All Blacks tight-head prop Charlie Faumuina, and centres George Moala and Rene Ranger each set to come on as replacements. Melani Nanai has been named on the wing. Source: Getty Images 
MELBOURNE REBELS V AUCKLAND BLUES 
KICK-OFF: 7:45pm AEDT, AAMI Park 
REFEREE: Angus Gardner 
SQUADS 
(Blues 15-1): Michael Collins, Matt Duffie, Rieko Ioane, Piers Francis, Melani Nanai, Ihaia West, Augustine Pulu, Akira Ioane, Blake Gibson, Steven Luatua, Gerard Cowley-Tuioti, Jimmy Tupou, Sione Mafileo, Matt Moulds, Pauliasi Manu 
Reserves: Hame Faiva, Sam Prattley, Charlie Faumuina, Scott Scrafton, Murphy Taramai, Sam Nock, George Moala, Rene Ranger. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
